alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Matanuska Valley; Northeast Prince William Sound; Southeast Prince William Sound; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:47PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL EVENT ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY... Widespread rain is expected across Southcentral Alaska through the weekend as a series of storm systems move across the region. Rain will overspread Southcentral from west to east through the day on Friday. Rain is expected to intensify across the Anchorage Bowl and Mat-Su Valleys by Friday evening with moderate to heavy rain at times continuing through Saturday morning. The heaviest rain is then expected to move east over the eastern Kenai Peninsula and Prince William Sound through Saturday night. A second storm system is then expected to bring another round of moderate to heavy rain across the western Kenai Peninsula, Anchorage Bowl, and Mat-Su Valleys for Sunday morning. Rain is expected to taper off and transition to showers from west to east across Southcentral through the day Sunday. More rain is possible across Southcentral for early next week. Storm total rainfall amounts will vary across the region through the weekend. However, most locations will likely see their heaviest rainfall totals in almost a year. Expected rainfall amounts through Monday morning: Anchorage Bowl: 1.5" to 2.0" Matanuska Valley: 1.5" to 2.0" Susitna Valley: 2.0" to 3.0" Western Kenai Peninsula: 1.0" to 1.5" Eastern Kenai Peninsula: 1.5" to 2.5" Whittier and Portage Valley: 2.0" to 4.0" Prince William Sound: 3.0" to 5.0" Copper River Basin: 0.5" to 1.0" The prolonged rain event could push small streams and creeks to or slightly above bankfull. Smaller rivers could see water levels rise to bankfull. Water levels along larger rivers are expected to remain below bankfull due to initial low water levels prior to the event. Ponding of water on area roadways is also possible. Please use caution when driving or when recreating along or on area waterways. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc
